info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 01 at 1:29AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...An intense lake effect snow band will affect Portage...Trumbull... southern Geauga...Medina...southeastern Cuyahoga...northeastern Ashland...Summit...northern Wayne...southern Lorain and southern Ashtabula Counties Until 330 AM EDT.... At 128 AM EDT, radar indicated an intense lake effect snow band along a line extending from near Andover to near Wellington, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARDS INCLUDE... Winds to 30 mph... Visibility rapidly dropping to less than a quarter of a mile... Up to 2 inches of quick snow accumulation... Locations impacted include... Akron, Warren, Medina, Wooster, Ravenna, Parma, Cuyahoga Falls, Strongsville, Brunswick, North Royalton, Kent, Barberton, Green, Solon, Hudson, Wadsworth, Niles, Twinsburg, Tallmadge, and Streetsboro. Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this lake effect snow band. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads are likely to lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until this snow band passes your location. && ODOT DMS 301, 305, 306, 316, 317, 318, 325, 327, 601, 602, 603, 606, 607, 610, 611, 612, 613, 614, 615, 616, 617, 604, 605, and 620.
